author: Kenan Machado
title: Global Markets Rise Slightly to Start the Week
text:
Dollar falls further from three-year low Chinese stocks drop after loan growth data U.S. markets closed for a holiday European stocks started the week with declines as the euro climbed past a three-year high against the dollar.
The Stoxx Europe 600 edged down 0.2% in morning trading Monday despite upbeat leads from the U.S. and Japan. The export-heavy health-care sector led losses, with companies that generate a large share of their revenues in the U.S., including Fresenius Medical Care, Sanofi and Merck, off 0.7% to 0.9%.
